Entities.Name: Bleeding event
Entities.Definition: Phrase or word indicative of the escape of blood from the circulatory system.

Entities.Name: Bleeding anatomic site
Entities.Definition: Location within the body where bleeding is observed.

Sample Data.Sentence: Bleeding was noted in the upper gastrointestinal tract.
Sample Data.Annotated: Bleeding anatomic site: upper gastrointestinal tract

Entities.Name: Suspected alternative cause
Entities.Definition: Possible non-direct causes of bleeding such as medications or other medical conditions.

Sample Data.Sentence: Patient is on anticoagulant therapy which might cause excessive bleeding.

Entities.Name: Severity
Entities.Definition: The severity level of the bleeding event, such as mild or severe.

Sample Data.Sentence: The patient experienced severe bleeding post-operation.

Entities.Name: Medication
Entities.Definition: Medications that the patient is currently taking that could be related to the bleeding event.

Entities.Name: Bleeding lab evaluation
Entities.Definition: Lab tests performed to evaluate the bleeding or its effects.

Sample Data.Sentence: Lab tests showed an increase in coagulation time suggesting bleeding.
Sample Data.Annotated: Bleeding lab evaluation: increased coagulation time

Dataset.Name: De-identified EHR Notes for Bleeding Events
Dataset.Details: This dataset includes 1,079 de-identified EHR notes annotated for various bleeding-related entities, used for training NLP models to automatically extract these events.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: The guidelines involved detailed annotation of bleeding-related entities in de-identified EHR notes, focusing on accurate identification of the entities with reference to anatomic sites, causes, medications, lab evaluations, and severity. The annotation was supervised by senior physicians with regular meetings to ensure consistency.
